intro: Erigeron tatrae, commonly known as the Tatra fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe, particularly the Tatra Mountains. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Erigeron tatrae is known for its small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
